Author: mrlynch#5735
Content:
We have decided to run for 3 regions in the 2019 Notary Node Elections:
- Europe [EU]
- North America [NA]
- Asia Russia [AR]

After running in an unofficial testnet for the past week with good results I believe 2 or 3 nodes will be manageable at high performance for the Pirate Notary Team and will help our project tremendously.

Please see our election details and promises at https://notary.pirate.black
Official election page: https://komodoelection.com/proposals/pirate/
Testnet stats: https://notarystats.info/testnet.php

We need your votes mateys! ARRR
Thank you for your attention.

Author: BlackJesus#6161
Content: Was pirate able to migrate to sprout from my understanding the difference between sprout and it's predecessor is sprout is a whole new style of address that is more energy efficient but achieves the same style or anonymity of the original zk-snarks transaction. Which is why it's possible to deprecate the old style.

Author: FishyGuts#5085
Content: We are fully Sapling only now.  Sprout has been deprecated.   1st chain in crypto to do so. üëç

Content:
Theres no such thing as one type of anything really.   How many single mfg cellphones/cars/computers do we know of?  Beverages/food/socks.  
There's room for ecosystem growth everywhere and working together strengthens that.

Content: hey guys, any mining pool operators here?

Author: NickH#5815
Content: How come komodod doesn't respect the `-mineraddress=XXX`

Author: ComputerGenie üë¥üèºüì¢#7004
Content: @jl777c

Author: NickH#5815
Content: We (Luxor) run nodes in multiple regions and provide the address of the wallet in the payment processor node.  We weren't seeing the blocks found in other regions showing up in the payment processor's wallet, and found that the coinbase is being sent to a different wallet address

Author: phm87#7395
Content: I think that you can use the same wallet.dat in each node (or import privkey)

Author: ComputerGenie üë¥üèºüì¢#7004
Content: @NickH you can use `-pubkey=xxxxxx` and use the pub key for that address

Author: NickH#5815
Content: is a new address generated for each template? some daemons do that, which wouldn't work

Author: NickH#5815
Content: bc the payment processor node wouldn't know which addresses have been generated from it's pubkey

Author: ComputerGenie üë¥üèºüì¢#7004
Content:
`is a new address generated for each template? ` by default, yes
if, however, you have the priv key imported and use `-pubkey=xxxxxx` it will do what you expected from  mineraddress

Author: ComputerGenie üë¥üèºüì¢#7004
Content: or you could just force your stratum to make vout[0] whatever addy you choose

Author: NickH#5815
Content: we use the GBT generated by the daemon.

Author: NickH#5815
Content: I supposed we could modify it

Author: NickH#5815
Content: ok.  well, if we went with the pubkey method, I guess we have to give up some security there, then?  Most of our coins have the payment processor behind a firewall so they aren't exposed to the web.

Author: ComputerGenie üë¥üèºüì¢#7004
Content:
`I guess we have to give up some security there, then? `
I'm not sure what security you're giving up by your daemon owing the key you mine to

Author: NickH#5815
Content: well, peers would be able to figure out the IP of a server containing a crypto wallet.

Author: NickH#5815
Content: Currently, if any of our servers are compromised (for whatever reason), there's no keys on any of them.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: we implemented -pubkey= before -mineraddress was implemented, i think there were some conflicts to merge in the -mineraddress, but since it is essentially the same function, there didnt seem much point to add.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: i dont understand how there is any difference in security using -pubkey vs. -mineraddress

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the -pubkey can even be to a cold wallet, so it is not divulging the ip of any node

Author: NickH#5815
Content: yeah, pubkey is fine, i experimented with it and got what I needed

Author: NickH#5815
Content: i read Genie's comments as needing to import the privkey into the remote node

Author: NickH#5815
Content: All good now, we're mining blocks üëç

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: oh, no need to do that. I made the -pubkey especially for remote mining, i couldnt stand the zillions of addresses being generated for some false sense of privacy

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: if you want privacy, just use PIRATE!

Author: CHMEX#0686
Content: -pubkey not privkey

Author: NickH#5815
Content: plz make sure to use `-pubkey` any future travelers
